summary.p: The Tiruppukaḻ is a collection of hymns in honour of Murukaṉ by Aruṇakirinātar (15th century).
The bundle is complete. It contains 5 pāyiram stanzas and 164 tiruppukāls.
Paratexts: marginal and in-text benedictions, title-page, preface folio (ciṟappupāyiram), colophon.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (June 2019).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

collation.desc: 1 folio = Tiruppukaḻ: Title Page (additional). No foliation. Double folio. Verso blank.
1 folio = Tiruppukaḻ: Preface, that is, the Ciṟappuppāyiram of the printed editions. No foliation.
70 folios = Tiruppukaḻ: Text. Tamil foliation 1-70. 5 to 6 lines per page.
1 folio = Colophon. No foliation. Verso blank.
1 folio = guard leaf. No foliation. Double leaf.

supportDesc.condition: Very good state of preservation, in spite of bore holes caused by insects.

additions.desc: BnF current shelfmark sticker, covering an older sticker: INDIEN 340 (front cover, recto).
BnF donation sticker DON N° (front cover, recto).
Shelfmark sticker (Société Asiatique?), written in black ink: 440 (f[1]r).

binding.p: Pinewood covers apparently fabricated in the BnF.

origin.origDate: Internally dated to the year viḷampi of the Jovian cycle, that is, CE 1839-1840, 1779-1780, 1719-1720, etc. See copy beginning statement colophon (U3, f[1]r). Dated to February 27, 1779 by Vinson in Vinson et al. (1866-) and to 1779 by Cabaton (1912). Not after 1854, since part of the collection of Édouard Ariel (1818-1854), bequeathed in 1855 to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1868).

provenance.p: Owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). Bequeathed by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. — See BnF, Département des Manuscrits, Inventaire 7 = dons : manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, n° 1 à 3306: no. 1192.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 49, no. 340.
Rosny, Léon de. 1868. La bibliothèque tamoule de M. Ariel, de Pondichéry. In: Variétés orientales (pp. 177‒224). Paris: Maisonneuve.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 77r, no. 314 340.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
